item.title: Never Push a Work Commit with Your Personal Email Again
item.description: As developers, itâ€™s common to wear multiple hats â€” working on company projects during the day and tinkering with open-source or personal side-projects at night. If youâ€™ve ever accidentally committed to Git using your personal email in a company repo (or worse, pushed your work identity to a public repo ðŸ˜…), you know how frustrating it can be. I used to run into this problem often, especially since I used the same laptop for both work and personal projects.
